snippet: Research by economists from the International Monetary Fund make a compelling case that greater equality and lower debt could make future crises less likely.
abstract: Editorial observes that research by economists has shown that growing income inequality and the increasing reliance on personal debt by American households has left the American financial system and the broader economy ever more vulnerable to crisis.
lead_paragraph: Research by economists from the International Monetary Fund make a compelling case that greater equality and lower debt could make future crises less likely.
